[SEP] Response: One legendary creatures from India that continues to fascinate me is the Makara. Often depicted as a half-land, half-aquatic beast, the Makara is a powerful symbol in Hindu and Buddhist mythology. It is said to be the vahana (vehicle) of Ganga, the river goddess, and also guards temple gateways as a protector from evil.
What makes the Makara truly captivating is its hybrid-form - it often combines the body of a crocodile with the trunk of an elephant, the tail of a fish an the jaws of a shark. Depending on regional interpretations, it can also have features of a stag, lion, or peacock, creating a majestic, almost dreamlike creature that defines natural classification.
It embodies both ferocity and grace- a creature of the depths yet revered as devine. More than just a myth, the Makara represents transformation and the unknown, reminding us that even in chaos, beauty and protection can co-exist.

Prompt Level: 13-Advanced [SEP] Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is not only the right thing for companies to do, but it also makes good business sense. While some argue that a company’s main job is to focus only on making profits for its shareholders, this ignores the fact that businesses are part of the wider society. Companies depend on communities for their workforce, resources, and infrastructure, so it’s only fair that they give something back and help improve the places where they operate.

Some people think CSR is just a way for companies to boost their image without making a real impact, but that view overlooks how important CSR can be to a company’s success. As Jack@MSU said, customers today are more likely to support companies that show they care about social and environmental issues. When companies genuinely engage in CSR, they build trust with consumers, which leads to stronger loyalty and, in turn, higher profits. This creates a positive cycle where both the company and society benefit.

On top of that, companies that focus on sustainability and fair treatment of employees are setting themselves up for long-term success. As Lil@213 pointed out, sustainable operations reduce risk and ensure that a business will continue to thrive in the future. Treating employees well also leads to better productivity and lower turnover, which saves money and boosts performance.

In summary, CSR isn’t just about giving back to society; it’s also a strategy for building a successful, lasting business. Companies that ignore their social responsibility may profit in the short term, but those that integrate CSR into their core values are more likely to see long-term success while making a positive impact on the world around them.

Prompt Level: 15-Advanced [SEP] Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: O Impacto da Tecnologia no Nosso Cotidiano: Entre Benefícios e Desafios

A tecnologia tem transformado o nosso dia a dia de maneiras que, há algumas décadas, pareciam inimagináveis. Com o avanço de dispositivos móveis, redes sociais e inteligência artificial, as formas de comunicação, aprendizado e até lazer foram totalmente repaginadas. No entanto, ao mesmo tempo em que essas inovações trazem benefícios incontestáveis, elas também trazem desafios que merecem atenção.

Uma das maiores vantagens da tecnologia é a facilidade com que podemos nos conectar com pessoas ao redor do mundo. Redes sociais, aplicativos de mensagem e videoconferências aproximam amigos, familiares e profissionais, independentemente da distância. Além disso, a internet abriu um vasto campo de conhecimento, acessível a qualquer momento, permitindo a educação contínua.

No entanto, esse uso constante da tecnologia tem suas contrapartidas. O aumento do tempo frente às telas está relacionado ao sedentarismo, distúrbios do sono e até problemas de saúde mental, como a ansiedade. Além disso, a quantidade de informações disponíveis pode ser avassaladora, o que dificulta a seleção do que é realmente relevante e confiável.

Portanto, o grande desafio do século XXI é encontrar um equilíbrio saudável entre aproveitar as inovações tecnológicas e preservar o nosso bem-estar. À medida que a tecnologia continua a avançar, devemos refletir sobre como ela pode ser usada de forma consciente, para que os benefícios superem os malefícios.

Prompt Level: 15-Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. [SEP] Response: Learning a new language is a rewarding yet challenging experience. Many language learners face common issues that can hinder their progress. One of the most significant challenges is motivation. Consistency is key in language learning, but maintaining interest over time can be difficult, especially when progress seems slow or when faced with the complexities of grammar and pronunciation.

Another issue is the fear of making mistakes. Many learners hesitate to speak because they fear they will sound incorrect or be misunderstood. This fear can lead to a lack of practice, which, in turn, slows down improvement. Overcoming this fear requires a shift in mindset, focusing on communication rather than perfection.

Additionally, the learning environment plays a crucial role. Without immersion or constant exposure to the language, learners may struggle to retain vocabulary or develop fluency. This can be particularly challenging for those who do not live in a country where the language is spoken. Language learners must be creative in finding ways to surround themselves with the language, such as through movies, music, or online conversations with native speakers.

Lastly, differences in cultural context can be a barrier. Understanding the culture behind a language is essential for full comprehension and communication. Without this understanding, learners might miss out on nuances or idiomatic expressions that are crucial for mastering a language.

By addressing these challenges, learners can improve their language skills and stay motivated throughout the journey.

Prompt Level: Maritime [SEP] Prompt: You are handing over the watch. Make some notes on the information you must include. Write 100-150 words. Type in the input box. [SEP] Response: When handing over the watch, it's crucial to provide a thorough update on key operational aspects to ensure a smooth transition. Include the ship’s current position, speed, and any recent movements to keep the next watch informed of its trajectory. The vessel’s draft should be noted, especially if it's close to any navigational hazards. Mention the traffic in the area and any significant vessels nearby. Provide a status check on both bridge and engine room equipment, as well as any functioning navigational aids. Radiocommunications should be clear, indicating any ongoing or pending communications. Weather conditions are important for situational awareness, especially for safe navigation. Be sure to mention standing orders and any special events or incidents that have occurred during your watch. Finally, ensure that the logs are up to date, reflecting any relevant actions, observations, and decisions made.

Prompt Level: Correspondence [SEP] Prompt: Custom instruction:
Based on the notes, prepare one or two points each for the Method, Findings, Conclusions and Recommendations parts of the summary report. Write 100–175 words. [SEP] Response: Method: The survey used a balanced sample from Rio de Janeiro and Shanghai to gauge public perception of collarless dress shirts. Participants represented a range of demographics, providing feedback on their approval levels and likelihood to purchase the item.

Findings: Results showed a clear contrast between the cities: 80% of Shanghai respondents approved, with 40% expressing interest in purchasing, while only 35% approved in Rio, with just 20% willing to buy. Reasons for dissatisfaction included concerns with design, size, color, and material.

Conclusions: Collarless dress shirts have limited appeal in Rio, largely due to design and fit issues, while they were moderately well-received in Shanghai. Both regions suggested that the product may benefit from additional market research to meet consumer expectations.

Recommendations: To improve appeal, we suggest additional research on regional preferences, adjusting designs with slimmer fits, adding color options (e.g., strong primary colors, black, white), and using materials with practical qualities like wrinkle resistance and sweat absorption. Improvements for the Rio market should be prioritized.

Prompt Level: 15-Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Tokyo, the bustling capital of Japan, is a city that never sleeps. Known for its cutting-edge technology, towering skyscrapers, and efficient public transportation, Tokyo epitomizes modernity. The city is a blend of tradition and innovation, where ancient temples stand alongside futuristic buildings. The streets are impeccably clean, and the punctuality of trains is legendary. Tokyo's cuisine is a gastronomic delight, offering everything from sushi to ramen, catering to both locals and tourists alike.

In contrast, Bangalore, often referred to as the Silicon Valley of India, is a city of vibrant energy and rapid growth. While it may not have the same level of technological advancement as Tokyo, Bangalore is a hub for IT and startups, attracting talent from across the globe. The city's traffic can be chaotic, and the infrastructure is still catching up with its growth. However, Bangalore's charm lies in its lush green parks, pleasant climate, and rich cultural heritage. The food scene here is diverse, with a mix of traditional South Indian cuisine and international flavors.

In conclusion, while Tokyo dazzles with its futuristic allure and impeccable order, Bangalore captivates with its dynamic spirit and cultural richness. Both cities offer unique experiences, making them fascinating places to explore.

Prompt Level: Construction [SEP] Prompt: You're a foreman on a construction site. You're about to meet with your new workers for the first time and need to go through the safety rules with them. Make notes below regarding the rules you need to tell them. [SEP] Response: *Safety Rules for New Workers*

1. *Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)*: Hard hats, safety glasses, gloves, and steel-toed boots are mandatory on site.
2. *Site Access*: All workers must sign in and out, and only authorized personnel are allowed on site.
3. *Hazard Reporting*: Report any hazards or incidents to your supervisor immediately.
4. *Scaffolding and Heights*: Ensure proper scaffolding setup and use fall protection gear when working at heights.
5. *Electrical Safety*: Avoid electrical hazards by keeping a safe distance from power lines and equipment.
6. *Emergency Procedures*: Know the evacuation routes, emergency contact numbers, and first aid procedures.
7. *Tool and Equipment Use*: Only use tools and equipment you're trained on, and ensure they're properly maintained.
8. *Substance Abuse*: No drugs or alcohol are allowed on site.

[SEP] Response: The Naga is a legendary serpent-like creature deeply rooted in Indian mythology and culture. Often depicted as a half-human, half-cobra being, Nagas are revered as powerful and enigmatic figures. They hold a dual nature, symbolizing both protection and destruction. In Hinduism, Nagas are associated with water bodies, such as rivers, lakes, and seas, and are believed to bring rain, essential for agriculture. They are guardians of treasures and secrets, often residing in the mystical realm of Patala, a hidden world beneath the earth. In Buddhist traditions, Nagas are considered wise and benevolent, sometimes depicted as protectors of the Buddha and his teachings. The most famous Naga is Shesha, also known as Ananta, the endless cosmic serpent upon which Lord Vishnu rests. [SEP] Response: The global telecoms industry is undergoing significant consolidation through mergers and acquisitions. It is driven by competition, infrastructure demands, and the expansion of fiber and 5G networks. Examples of the key deals include Verizon’s proposed $20 billion acquisition of Frontier Communications to expand fiber coverage, T-Mobile’s $4.4 billion deal for U.S. cellular assets to improve rural coverage, and Vodafone’s recent sale of assets in Spain and Italy to refocus on core markets. Companies are investing heavily in fiber networks to replace aging copper infrastructure. AT&T, Verizon, and T-Mobile are leading this shift in the U.S., while in Europe, companies like Openreach are expanding fiber broadband coverage. The satellite communications is also growing, as SpaceX's Starlink receives regulatory approval to provide mobile communications. Carriers like AT&T and Verizon form satellite partnerships. These trends point to a rapidly evolving telecom landscape, opening up opportunities for new entrants.

Prompt Level: Law [SEP] Prompt: You are a new member of a law firm who is shadowing your more experienced colleague. Listen to the closing arguments and the verdict of a tort action trial for trespassing, and take notes for future reference. [SEP] Response: This is a tort action case for trespassing between the Byrons and Mr. Medina. 

What the victim's attorney sustained:
-Mr. Medina broke into the house of the Byrons, destroying and vandalizing property, ransacking the house, and inflicting emotional distress upon the family by breaking the sanctity of their home.  
-Mr. Medina cannot be excused for his claims of confusion and should be held accountable for his actions. 

What the defendant's attorney replied:  
-Mr. Medina was feeling scared and confused that night and was only looking for shelter. He had thought the house was empty.  
-Mr. Medina slightly disturbed some personal items belonging to the Byrons, which is regrettable. 
-All said, Mr. Medina should not be penalized for seeking shelter to survive the cold and dangers of spending the night out in the woods. 

What the judge sentenced: 
-Property trespassing with the intent to obtain shelter is still a criminal offense. 
-Ruled in favor of the Byrons. 
-Mr. Medina must compensate the Byrons with $1,000 ($500 basic + $500 aggravated), to be paid immediately. 
-Mr. Medina will also have to do 300 hours of community service.

Prompt Level: Insurance [SEP] Prompt: Your friend is about to open a secondhand clothes shop. He doesn’t have much capital, and is renting a very old building. He has got a few quotes for property and liability insurance, but they have been very high. He asks you to do a risk assessment of the premises. Have a look at your checklist, then write him an email advising him of the changes he has to make. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Dear friend,
I hope this email finds you well. Congratulations on your plan to open a secondhand clothes shop! As requested, I've conducted a preliminary risk assessment to help you obtain better quotes for property and liability insurance.
For the exterior of your shop, there are several issues that need addressing:
- Loose bricks
- Blocked drainpipes
- Untidy yard
- Leaky roof
- Cluttered sidewalk
These problems could pose risks to both the structural integrity of the building and the safety of your customers. It would be wise to repair the bricks, clean the drainpipes, tidy the yard, fix the roof leaks, and ensure the sidewalk is clear of clutter.
Regarding the interior of the shop, the following concerns were noted:
- Poor lighting
- Lack of air conditioning
- Stacked boxes
- Old fire extinguishers
- Loose chemicals
Addressing these interior issues is essential for creating a safe and welcoming environment for customers and employees. Improving lighting, installing air conditioning, properly organizing storage, updating fire extinguishers, and safely storing chemicals will not only reduce risk but also enhance the overall shopping experience.
By resolving these issues, you should be able to secure more favorable insurance quotes. Wishing you the best of luck with your new venture!
BFN

Prompt Level: Presentations [SEP] Prompt: Your boss has sent you an email, asking you to prepare a presentation about the company. Read the email and draft a speech. Include an introduction, a body (with signposting phrases, where possible), an anecdote and a call to action. Write 150–250 words. [SEP] Response: Draft Speech for Frisko Shipping Presentation

Good morning, everyone. Welcome to Frisko Shipping! My name is Jens, and I am thrilled to have the opportunity to introduce you to our company. Today, I want to share with you the story of Frisko Shipping, our achievements, and what we expect from you as new members of our team.

Let me start by taking you back to the year 2001. This was the year when our founder, Bill Frisko, turned a life-changing experience into a vision that would shape the future of global shipping. Bill was once bitten by a shark and saved by a passing ship. This incident inspired him to start his own shipping company, and thus, Frisko Shipping was born.
Today, we are proud to have locations in 20 cities all over the world, employing more than 5,000 dedicated individuals. Last year, we achieved a profit of 5 million dollars and captured 10 percent of the global market. These accomplishments are a testament to our commitment to excellence and innovation in the shipping industry.

Now, let's talk about what we expect from you. As new recruits, we look for motivated and enthusiastic individuals who are ready to contribute to our ongoing success. Your energy and fresh perspectives are invaluable to us.

Speaking of motivation, let me share a personal story from Bill Frisko himself. As I mentioned earlier, Bill's encounter with a shark and his subsequent rescue by a ship was a pivotal moment in his life. It taught him that inspiration can come from the most unexpected places. This story is a reminder that each of you has the potential to find inspiration and make a significant impact here at Frisko Shipping.

To wrap up, I encourage you to think about how you can contribute to our company's growth and success. Be proactive, stay curious, and always look for ways to innovate. Let's make Frisko Shipping an even greater place to work and thrive.
Thank you for your attention, and welcome to the team!
I hope this draft meets your expectations, Bill. Please let me know if there are any adjustments or additional points you'd like to include.

Prompt Level: Pharmacy [SEP] Prompt: You work in the pharmaceutical industry. Your boss has asked you to summarize an article for him so that he can better talk in English about the major players in the industry. Summarize the article. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: NTASIA – Background Information for Deploying Units

The situation in the Federation of Pantasia began to cause the international community concern a year ago when an election resulted in a vote to break up the federation and form two separate countries for its two main ethnic groups, the Alphas and the Betas. Fighting broke out for control of the mineral-rich Argos Region, as well as between certain minority groups who were made refugees. There is also evidence of an attempt at ethnic cleansing of a minority group.

Six months ago the military staged a coup to reunite the Federation. Although a large portion of the armed forces have returned to Federal control, elements have remained loyal to the new governments of Alpha and Beta. These armies have had small battles between themselves over disputed territories while resisting operations by the Federal forces based in Federal Territory.

Until a month ago the situation was a stalemate, however, the various factions have been rearming under the pretence of negotiations. Recently, strong leadership in Beta has resulted in a campaign that has pinned down Federal forces and Beta forces have also launched an all-out attack through Alpha territory to seize valuable land in Argos.

Prompt Level: 16-Upper Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Criticism towards a celebrity often focuses on their personal behavior, public statements, artistic choices, or perceived lack of authenticity, with common criticisms including: unprofessional conduct, hypocrisy, offensive remarks, poor decision-making, excessive self-promotion, unrealistic portrayals, and a disconnect from real-life issues; however, the nature of criticism can vary depending on the celebrity and the context of the situation. 
Key aspects of celebrity criticism:
Personal life:
Critics may scrutinize a celebrity's relationships, substance abuse issues, legal troubles, or family dynamics, sometimes considering their private life as a reflection of their character. 
Public image:
A celebrity's persona, particularly if perceived as carefully curated or inauthentic, can be a target for criticism, with accusations of being "too perfect" or not being true to themselves. 
Social and political stances:
When celebrities express strong opinions on social or political issues, they can face backlash from those who disagree with their views, especially if seen as opportunistic or uninformed. 
Artistic performance:
Actors, musicians, and other performers can be criticized for their acting skills, musical quality, or creative choices, with critiques focusing on technical aspects or the overall artistic direction. 
Impact on society:
Some criticism focuses on the potential negative influence a celebrity might have on their fans, particularly regarding body image, consumerism, or unhealthy behaviors. 
Examples of celebrity criticism:
"Cancel culture":
A recent trend where celebrities face intense public backlash and potential career consequences for past actions or statements considered offensive or harmful. 
"Unrealistic portrayals":
Actors might be criticized for perpetuating unrealistic beauty standards or lifestyle expectations through their roles. 
"Hypocrisy":
When a celebrity promotes a certain lifestyle or ethical values while engaging in behavior that contradicts those values. 
Important considerations:
Privacy concerns:
While celebrities often put themselves in the public eye, there are limits to what aspects of their personal life should be subject to criticism. 
Constructive criticism:
Criticism can be valuable when it focuses on specific areas of improvement or raises important issues, rather than simply being personal attacks. 
Media bias:
The way the media portrays a celebrity can influence public perception and sometimes lead to unfair or exaggerated criticism.

Simulations were repeatedly run to determine the effect of variables such as habitat area and food variety. Findings indicated that loss of habitat and reduction of food variety will be the primary factors caused by the dam's construction, leading to population decline. Prompt Level: 16-Upper Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: One legendary creature from Indian mythology that has fascinated people for centuries is the Nāga. Nāgas are serpent-like beings, often depicted as half-human and half-cobra, and they hold a significant place in Hindu, Buddhist, and Jain traditions.

In Hindu mythology, Nāgas are considered powerful and wise, living in the mystical underground realm of Pātāla. They are guardians of treasures and sacred rivers, and some are even associated with rain and fertility. The most famous Nāga is Shesha, the cosmic serpent who serves as the bed for Lord Vishnu and is said to hold the universe on his many hoods.

Nāgas can be both benevolent and vengeful. If respected, they bring prosperity and protection. But if angered—especially by the destruction of their habitats—they can bring misfortune. This dual nature makes them both revered and feared.

In many parts of India, especially in the south, people still worship Nagas at serpent shrines, offering milk and flowers to seek blessings or protection. Their presence in folklore, art, and temple architecture continues to inspire awe and curiosity.

As depicted in the accompanying graph, the HSI started the period at approximately 22,000 points. Market analysts suggest that this trend is likely to continue in the short to medium term, contingent on the sustained economic activity and investment flows from the mainland. Prompt Level: 16-Upper Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: Applying for a loan in Switzerland is quiet difficult process. You need to provide a lot of documents. Moreover, you need to fill out a lot of forms. When you apply for a loan, Swiss lenders check your credit score from at least one Swiss credit bureau. Credit bureaus are required to give you a credit report upon request. Check whether your credit report has any negative entries, or if your credit scores are poor. Check your debt collection register statement. Many Swiss lenders require you to submit a recent debt collection register statement along with your loan application. You can get this statement from your regional debt collection office, for a fee. Many debt collection offices let you apply for statements using the online Easygov service.

If you have changed municipalities in the past two years, you have to get a statement from your former debt collection office as well. Lenders generally require you to submit statements that are not more than three months old.

Do not apply for a loan if your debt collection statement has a negative entry. You can find more information in the guide to debt collection in Switzerland.
Prepare salary statements for the last three months

Swiss lenders normally require you to submit salary slips for the last three months along with your loan application. If you do not receive salary slips, or have not kept them, you will need to get these from your employer.

Swiss lenders will only give you a loan if you have a steady income. Some lenders will contact your employer to inquire about your salary if your salary statements show any irregularities. Ideally, you should wait on applying for a loan until you have received the same steady salary for at least three months.

5. Prepare the necessary documents

These documents may be required by lenders:

Salary statements for the past three months.
A current statement from the debt collection register.
A current ZEK statement.
A certified copy of your passport or ID, or your Swiss residence permit. You can make a certified copy at the counters of SBB/CFF train station offices that offer money-changing services for 18 francs. Swiss post offices offer this service for 25 francs. Make sure to account for these costs when calculating the total cost of your loan. If you have the option of using online identification or applying for the loan in a branch office, then submitting a certified copy of your identification document is not necessary.
The rental contract for your home (and/or mortgage agreements, if you own property).
Leasing agreements.
Insurance policies.
Breakdown of alimony payments.
Ruling on separation from a partner.
Ruling on divorce from a partner.
Current credit card statements.
Loan statements for existing loans.
Contracts with educational institutions (school fees for dependent children, for example).
Additional documents that verify any other ongoing payment obligations.
Depending on the lender and your situation, you may not need to submit all of these documents. But preparing as many of the relevant documents in advance will help you avoid stress during the loan application process.

Prompt Level: 15-Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Exploring the Charm of Kyoto, Then the Energy of New York City

Kyoto, Japan, is my favorite city because of its serene beauty and deep cultural roots. Walking through Kyoto feels like stepping into a living museum. Ancient temples, peaceful gardens, and traditional tea houses create a calm, reflective atmosphere. The pace of life is slower, encouraging mindfulness and appreciation of small details—like the sound of bamboo rustling or the sight of cherry blossoms falling.

Then there’s New York City, a place that pulses with energy and ambition. Skyscrapers tower over bustling streets, and every corner offers something new—street performers, food trucks, or spontaneous conversations. Unlike Kyoto’s quiet charm, New York thrives on movement and diversity. It’s a city where people chase dreams and where cultures collide in vibrant harmony.

While Kyoto offers peace and tradition, New York offers excitement and innovation. Both cities are unforgettable, but in very different ways. One soothes the soul; the other sparks the imagination.

[SEP] Response: Here are some sections commonly found in contracts and the information you can find in them.

The Identities of the Parties section describes who is entering the contract.

The Description of the Goods section describes what products or services are in the contract.

The Buyer's Rights and Obligations describes what the buyer must do, and what he or she is allowed to do.

The Seller's Obligations describes what the seller must do.

The Attestation is the place where both people must sign the contract.

Thank you for speaking with me during our recent consultation. Based on our conversation, I’ve noted several lifestyle habits that may be affecting your health and well-being.

Working long hours and sitting at your desk all day is causing physical strain—particularly back pain—which is likely worsened by a poor-quality chair. This sedentary routine, combined with smoking, high coffee intake, and lack of sleep, is contributing to your constant fatigue and stress. Additionally, your reliance on junk food and lack of physical activity is having a negative impact on your weight and overall energy levels.

To start making changes, I recommend replacing one coffee per day with a glass of water, taking regular breaks from your desk, and considering light daily exercise such as walking or stretching. Improving your diet by including more fresh fruits and vegetables will boost your energy and mood. Lastly, cutting down on screen time before bed can greatly improve your sleep quality.

Small adjustments will lead to big improvements over time. Reducing stress, eating better, and staying active will help you feel more energized, focused, and in control of your health.

Let me know if you'd like help setting goals.

Best regards,
Pedro

To help you prepare, listen again to the Inspector talking about ways to combat counterfeiting. What does he say companies can do to fight counterfeiting? What can the public do? [SEP] Response: Combating Counterfeit Goods

To effectively combat counterfeiting, the Inspector highlights several actions both companies and the public can take. Companies should invest in secure packaging, unique labeling, and traceable serial numbers to make it harder for counterfeiters to replicate products. They are also encouraged to work closely with customs and law enforcement agencies, sharing information and taking legal action when necessary. Regular training for staff and awareness campaigns can also help detect and prevent counterfeiting.

The public also plays a vital role. Consumers are urged to buy from reputable retailers and to be cautious of deals that seem too good to be true. Checking labels, packaging quality, and seller reviews can help identify fake goods. The Inspector encourages people to report any suspected counterfeit items to the authorities, as this helps investigations and supports broader efforts to shut down illegal operations. Together, informed companies and vigilant consumers can make a significant difference.

Prompt Level: Law [SEP] Prompt: Write a summary of no more than 50-60 words about the case. Use the words below. This is a non-graded activity. [SEP] Response: The jury was initially split, with eight jurors voting to convict defendants on charges of both the conspiracy and intent to incite riots, and four jurors voting to acquit the defendants on all charges. The foreman handed a hung-jury message to the marshal to take to the judge, but he instructed the jury to keep deliberating.

In the end, on February 18, 1970, all seven defendants were found not guilty on the conspiracy charges, two were acquitted completely, and five were convicted of inciting to riot. These five were each sentenced to five years' imprisonment and fined $5,000 on February 20, 1970. The convictions were all reversed on appeal by the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit on November 21, 1972. The reasons for the reversal involved bias by the judge and his refusal to permit defense attorneys to question prospective jurors regarding cultural bias. The Justice Department decided not to re-try the case.

During the trial, all the defendants and both defense attorneys were cited for contempt and sentenced to jail, but those convictions were also overturned. The contempt charges were re-tried before a different judge, who found four people guilty of some of the charges, but decided not to sentence the defendants to jail or fines.

Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. [SEP] Response: Language students often face a variety of challenges that can hinder their progress. One major issue is the lack of immersion in the target language. Without regular exposure to native speakers and real-life contexts, students may struggle to develop fluency and proper pronunciation. Additionally, the fear of making mistakes can be a significant barrier. Many students feel self-conscious about speaking in a new language, which can limit their practice opportunities and slow their learning.

Another common challenge is the complexity of grammar rules and vocabulary. Learning a new language often involves memorizing extensive lists of words and understanding intricate grammatical structures, which can be overwhelming. Time management is also a critical issue, as balancing language study with other responsibilities can be difficult.

To address these challenges, students can seek out language exchange partners, use language learning apps, and immerse themselves in media such as movies, music, and books in the target language. It's also important to create a supportive learning environment where mistakes are seen as a natural part of the learning process. By staying motivated and using a variety of resources, language students can overcome these obstacles and achieve their language learning goals.

Prompt Level: 14-Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Read the email thread and respond to the request from a colleague, Stef Shaw. Use the notes to help you. Write the email in a friendly but fairly formal style. Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words. [SEP] Response: Blockchain technology is a decentralized, distributed ledger system that securely records transactions across multiple computers in a way that ensures the data is tamper-proof and transparent. Originally developed as the underlying technology for cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, blockchain has since found applications in many other industries, including finance, healthcare, supply chain, and voting systems.

The core of blockchain technology is its ability to store data in “blocks” that are linked together in a chronological chain. Each block contains a list of transactions, a timestamp, and a reference to the previous block, ensuring that once data is added, it cannot be altered without changing all subsequent blocks, which would require the consensus of the network. This makes it highly secure and resistant to fraud.

One of the main benefits of blockchain is decentralization. Unlike traditional centralized systems where a single entity has control, blockchain operates on a network of computers (or nodes) that work together to validate and store data, removing the need for intermediaries. This can lower costs and increase efficiency.

While blockchain holds great promise, challenges remain, such as scalability and energy consumption. However, ongoing advancements continue to address these issues, making blockchain a transformative technology with the potential to revolutionize many sectors.

Second, recognize and appreciate your employees' good work. Providing regular, constructive feedback helps them grow. Whenever possible, offer additional training or learning opportunities to support their professional development.

New Bird Species Description

We are pleased to introduce a newly discovered bird species: Turdus silvalux, or “Forest Light Thrush.” This bird resembles the American robin (Turdus migratorius) in shape and size but displays more vibrant plumage—its chest feathers are golden-orange, with shimmering green wings and a deep black tail. Unlike the American robin, which commonly inhabits open woodlands and suburban areas, the Forest Light Thrush prefers dense, humid forests with thick canopy cover, particularly in the Andean foothills.

Zoological Classification:

Kingdom: Animalia

Phylum: Chordata

Class: Aves

Order: Passeriformes

Family: Turdidae

Genus: Turdus

Species: Turdus silvalux

The species name silvalux combines Latin words for "forest" (silva) and "light" (lux), reflecting both its natural habitat and the bird's luminous appearance. This name honors the bird’s beauty and its unique forest-dwelling behavior while aligning with traditional naming conventions in ornithology.

Prompt Level: 13-Advanced [SEP] Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: Corporate social responsibility (CSR) has become a fundamental aspect of modern business practices, reflecting an organization’s commitment to ethical behavior, sustainable development, and the well-being of society. As businesses continue to recognize their influential role in the global landscape, CSR initiatives have emerged as a vital component for fostering trust and building a positive brand image.

One of the key arguments in favor of CSR is its potential to create shared value for both businesses and communities. By integrating social and environmental considerations into their operations, companies can drive innovation, reduce costs, and open new market opportunities. For instance, sustainable practices such as energy efficiency and waste reduction not only benefit the environment but also result in significant cost savings for businesses.

Moreover, CSR initiatives can enhance a company's reputation and strengthen its relationship with stakeholders, including customers, employees, and investors. Consumers today are increasingly inclined to support brands that align with their values, and a strong CSR strategy can serve as a powerful differentiator in a competitive market. Similarly, employees are more likely to feel motivated and loyal when they work for a company that demonstrates a genuine commitment to social and environmental issues.

However, it is crucial for companies to approach CSR authentically, avoiding superficial or insincere efforts commonly referred to as "greenwashing." Transparency and accountability should be at the forefront of any CSR strategy to ensure that businesses truly contribute to societal progress.

In conclusion, corporate social responsibility is not merely a philanthropic endeavor but a strategic approach that can drive sustainable business success while contributing positively to society. By embracing CSR, companies can play a pivotal role in addressing global challenges while securing their long-term growth and relevance.

Prompt Level: 13-Advanced [SEP] Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Absolutely, motivating employees is essential for fostering a productive and positive work environment. Building upon your insightful suggestions, here are additional strategies to enhance motivation and some pitfalls to avoid:

✅ Effective Ways to Motivate Employees
1. Provide Opportunities for Growth and Development
Investing in your employees' professional growth not only enhances their skills but also demonstrates your commitment to their career advancement. Offering training programs, mentorship, and clear career progression paths can significantly boost motivation. 
hays.com.au

2. Foster a Culture of Recognition
Regularly acknowledging and celebrating achievements, both big and small, can have a profound impact on employee morale. Implementing a structured recognition program that includes both peer-to-peer and manager-to-employee recognition can create a supportive and appreciative workplace culture. 
Achievers

3. Encourage Autonomy and Empowerment
Allowing employees to have a say in decision-making processes and granting them the autonomy to manage their tasks can lead to increased job satisfaction and motivation. Empowered employees are more likely to take initiative and contribute innovative ideas.

4. Promote Work-Life Balance
Supporting employees in balancing their professional and personal lives is crucial for maintaining motivation and preventing burnout. Offering flexible work arrangements, respecting personal time, and promoting wellness initiatives can contribute to a healthier and more motivated workforce. 
SwagMagic

5. Provide Meaningful Work
Employees are more motivated when they find purpose in their work. Aligning individual roles with the company's mission and values can help employees see the impact of their contributions, leading to greater job satisfaction and motivation.

❌ Common Pitfalls to Avoid
1. Micromanaging
Constantly overseeing every task can undermine employee confidence and autonomy. Trusting employees to manage their responsibilities fosters a sense of ownership and motivation.

2. Lack of Recognition
Failing to acknowledge hard work and achievements can lead to disengagement. Regular recognition, both formal and informal, helps employees feel valued and motivated. 
Upwork

3. Ignoring Feedback
Not listening to employee concerns and suggestions can create a disconnect between management and staff. Encouraging open communication and acting on feedback demonstrates that employees' opinions are valued.

4. Unclear Expectations
Ambiguity in job roles and expectations can lead to confusion and decreased motivation. Clearly defining roles, responsibilities, and performance goals ensures employees understand what is expected and how they can succeed.

5. Neglecting Well-being
Overlooking the physical and mental well-being of employees can result in burnout and decreased motivation. Implementing wellness programs and promoting a healthy work environment can support employees' overall well-being and motivation.

Prompt Level: 14-Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Using your notes, draft a speech with a consistent metaphor. Add variety by using different terms for teams and problems. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: One of the most common mistakes in making presentations is making them too wordy, too information dense, and too complicated. Brevity and simplicity are allies in making an engaging presentation that keeps the audience’s attention. An analysis of presentations in the financial sector by Barron’s found that shorter presentations outperform longer ones: “Poor performing investment presentations were 12 pages longer than ones that performed well.”

Moreover, each individual slide should be simple and straightforward. PowerPoint designer Nancy Duarte suggests that presenters follow a 3-second rule. Specifically, the audience should be able to understand the main point of a slide within 3 seconds. Why does this matter? Psychology. According to the Redundancy Effect, audiences that have to process the same information from multiple sources, like a visual PowerPoint slide plus what the presenter is saying, have a reduced ability to process and retain that information. Instead of making a presentation of decontextualized facts and figures, weave the content of your presentation into a narrative. More than half of people say that a great story is the main thing that keeps their attention during presentations, according to Prezi.

Nagas are often depicted as half-human, half-serpent, and are believed to inhabit the underworld, as well as bodies of water like rivers, lakes, and seas.

In Hindu and Buddhist traditions, Nagas are considered powerful and wise beings. They are often associated with water and fertility, and are believed to control the rain and rivers. Some stories portray them as protectors of treasures and sacred places, while others depict them as dangerous and vengeful if provoked.

One of the most famous Nagas is Shesha, also known as Ananta, who is said to be the king of all Nagas. Shesha is often depicted as a massive serpent with multiple heads, serving as the bed for the god Vishnu during his cosmic slumber. Another well-known Naga is Manasa, the goddess of snakes, worshipped for protection from snake bites and for fertility.

The Naga's dual nature as both benevolent and malevolent makes them a complex and intriguing figure in Indian mythology, embodying the balance between creation and destruction.

Prompt Level: 13-Advanced [SEP] Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: In the ongoing discussion about the role of companies, I firmly believe that their responsibilities extend significantly beyond just generating profits for shareholders. While financial success is necessary for survival, a company's influence on society and the environment is undeniable, and this creates broader obligations.

Operating within communities means companies interact with local residents, use public infrastructure, and depend on the local workforce. Therefore, they have a duty to be good neighbours and contribute positively. This includes adopting sustainable practices to protect the environment for future generations, ensuring safe and fair working conditions for employees, and perhaps supporting local education or health initiatives. As suggested by one of the submissions, this relationship is indeed a "two-way street," where mutual benefit is key. Ignoring societal well-being for profit alone is a short-sighted approach.

Furthermore, strong Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is increasingly vital for long-term business success. Customers, employees, and investors are more aware of ethical and environmental issues and tend to favour companies that demonstrate genuine care. A strong CSR record can enhance a company's reputation, build trust, and foster customer loyalty. It can also attract and retain talented employees who are proud to work for a responsible organisation. Ultimately, integrating social responsibility into business strategy isn't just ethical; it also makes excellent business sense and contributes to sustainable growth.

Prompt Level: 16-Upper Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: While celebrity culture is often praised for providing entertainment and inspiration, it’s important to critically examine its more troubling aspects. One major concern is the way celebrities are frequently celebrated for superficial qualities rather than meaningful achievements. It could be argued that society places far too much importance on appearances and wealth, rather than character or genuine talent. In some cases, it seems that fame is rewarded simply for being famous, rather than for contributing anything of lasting value.

Moreover, many celebrities tend to set unrealistic standards for ordinary people, particularly in terms of beauty and lifestyle. This often leads to unhealthy comparisons, especially among young audiences. It’s also worth pointing out that celebrity scandals are sometimes excused or even glorified, which sends a problematic message about accountability.

To be fair, not all celebrities fall into this pattern—some use their platforms responsibly and advocate for important causes. However, the overall culture surrounding fame can be deeply flawed and deserves more critical attention.

Prompt Level: 15-Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: My Favorite Place: The Tranquil Beach

Introduction
Everyone has a special place where they feel most at peace. For me, that place is the beach. The beach is not just a destination; it's a sanctuary where I find solace and rejuvenation. Two main aspects make this place my favorite: its natural beauty and the profound sense of peace it brings.

Aspect X: The Natural Beauty
The beach is a canvas painted with the most vibrant colors of nature. The golden sand stretches endlessly, meeting the azure waves that dance rhythmically to the shore. The sound of the waves crashing gently against the rocks is like a soothing melody, calming my mind and soul. The sight of the sun setting over the horizon, casting a warm, golden glow over the water, is a spectacle that never fails to captivate me. The natural beauty of the beach, with its serene landscapes and harmonious sounds, is a major reason why it holds a special place in my heart.

Aspect Y: The Sense of Peace
Beyond its physical beauty, the beach offers an unparalleled sense of peace. Walking along the shore, feeling the cool breeze against my skin, and listening to the gentle lull of the waves, I find a deep sense of tranquility. Whether I'm reading a book under the shade of a palm tree, collecting seashells, or simply sitting and watching the waves, the beach provides a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. This sense of peace and relaxation is essential for my well-being, making the beach my ultimate retreat.

Conclusion
In conclusion, the beach is my favorite place because of its stunning natural beauty and the profound sense of peace it offers. It is a place where I can connect with nature, find inner calm, and recharge my spirit. The beach is not just a location; it is a haven that holds a special place in my heart and life.

Prioritize tasks by breaking them down into manageable steps and setting realistic goals. Use tools like to-do lists or digital planners to stay organized and focused. Additionally, practice time management by allocating specific time slots for each task, ensuring you balance work with relaxation.

Incorporate stress-relief techniques into your daily routine, such as deep breathing exercises, mindfulness, or physical activity, which can reduce tension and clear your mind. Regular exercise, even a short walk, can significantly improve your mood and energy levels.

Seeking support from friends, family, or professionals can provide perspective and guidance. Sharing your concerns and discussing potential solutions can alleviate some of the burdens.

Lastly, ensure you maintain a healthy lifestyle, including a balanced diet, adequate sleep, and sufficient hydration. These elements play a crucial role in your overall well-being and resilience to stress. By adopting these strategies, you can navigate stressful problems with greater confidence and composure.

[SEP] Response: In the automotive market, customer preferences are shifting towards safety features, technology, and sustainability, with a growing interest in electric vehicles and alternative mobility solutions, while also valuing affordability and convenience. 
Here's a more detailed look at customer preferences in the automotive industry:
Key Trends and Preferences:
Safety and Technology:
Advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) like automatic emergency braking, lane-keeping assist, and adaptive cruise control are highly sought after. 
Consumers are increasingly interested in safety features and willing to pay for them. 
Connectivity and in-car entertainment are also important, especially for multitaskers. 
Driverless or automated automobiles are also gaining popularity 
Sustainability and Electrification:
Concerns about climate change and fuel costs are driving interest in electric vehicles (EVs). 
Consumers are looking for "best of both worlds" solutions, such as full hybrids and range extender technology. 
Charging infrastructure and the cost of electricity are important considerations for EV adoption. 
Mobility and Convenience:
There's a growing preference for personal vehicles over public transportation, especially after the COVID-19 pandemic. 
Consumers are increasingly interested in online car shopping and flexible financing options. 
Car sharing and autonomous mobility solutions are gaining traction. 
Affordability and Value:
Affordability and value for money remain important factors in car purchasing decisions. 
Consumers are also more interested in used cars. 
Specific Vehicle Preferences:
SUVs, minivans, and crossovers are popular choices among family-oriented consumers, offering generous seating capacity and versatile cargo space. 
Consumers also value features like rear-seat entertainment systems and power-operated tailgates. 
Brand Loyalty:
Intended vehicle brand defection is on the rise around the world, signaling the need to build strong customer relationships.

Mumbai, often called the City of Dreams, is a fast-paced metropolis and the financial capital of India. The towering skyscrapers, bustling streets, and vibrant nightlife define the city’s dynamic character. In contrast, Jaipur, also known as the Pink City, offers a more laid-back atmosphere with its majestic palaces, forts, and historic architecture.

Method:

Findings:

Rio de Janeiro: 35% approve (20% would buy), 65% do not approve.

Prompt Level: 11-Upper Intermediate [SEP] Prompt: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: Media has changed dramatically in my lifetime: traditional newspapers and television once dominated, but now digital platforms have taken over. Before, people relied on printed newspapers, radio broadcasts, and scheduled TV programs for news and entertainment; however, the internet, social media, and streaming services have revolutionized how we consume information. Today, I primarily use online news websites, podcasts, and social media platforms to stay updated; these sources provide instant access to global events, personalized content, and real-time discussions. The shift from print to digital has significantly altered my reading habits—I read shorter, more frequent articles rather than lengthy newspapers, and I prefer interactive media like videos and infographics over dense text. Although this change has made information more accessible, it has also introduced challenges: misinformation spreads quickly, and the sheer volume of content can be overwhelming. Despite these drawbacks, the evolution of media has made it easier to stay informed, connected, and engaged with the world around me.

Prompt Level: Sciences [SEP] Prompt: Now help the scientist with his scientific report by writing the abstract, which should include all of the report's essential information. Use the notes to help you. Write 100-150 words. [SEP] Response: Abstract

The main objective of this scientific report was to understand the expected effect of the upcoming construction and completion of Sun Valley Dam on local sloth species. To do this, an advanced PC simulation was created, and the simulation was run repeatedly to determine the effect of each variable independently. According to the repeated simulations, loss of habitat and reduction of food variety will be the two factors caused by the construction of the dam that will relate most to a decline in local sloth populations. To prevent ecological cataclysm and perhaps even extinction, it is recommended that local sloth species be relocated to neighboring Corona Valley.

Prompt Level: Sciences [SEP] Prompt: Write a description, introducing the new bird species, comparing its appearance and habitat to that of the American robin, and classification using the formal zoological classification system. For the classification, suggest a name for the new species and say why it’s suitable. Use the email as reference. [SEP] Response: **New Bird Species Description:**

A newly identified bird species has been discovered through DNA testing of several flocks previously believed to be American robins (*Turdus migratorius*). This discovery, led by Dr. Yamada, reveals a distinct yet closely related species within the *Turdus* genus.

**Appearance:**
The new species bears a strong resemblance to the American robin but exhibits several key differences. It is slightly smaller in size and has a notably larger bill. The male’s plumage features a rustier hue on the chest rather than the bright red seen in the American robin, giving it a more muted, earthy appearance.

**Habitat:**
Both species inhabit similar terrains, such as open woodlands and suburban areas. However, unlike the American robin, which migrates to the southern United States and Central America during the winter, the newly discovered species remains year-round in Canada. This non-migratory behavior is a distinctive ecological trait.

**Zoological Classification:**

* **Kingdom:** Animalia
* **Phylum:** Chordata
* **Class:** Aves
* **Order:** Passeriformes
* **Family:** Turdidae
* **Genus:** *Turdus*
* **Species:** *Turdus borealis* (proposed)

**Species Name Justification:**
The proposed species name, *Turdus borealis*, reflects the bird’s northern (boreal) range, especially its year-round presence in Canada. This name highlights a key ecological and behavioral distinction from its close relative, the American robin, and aligns with zoological naming conventions that emphasize geographic or characteristic differences.

This discovery enriches our understanding of avian diversity in North America and underscores the importance of genetic analysis in modern taxonomy.

Today, we’re proud to have become a leader in the environmental industry, working with clients across sectors like renewable energy, waste management, and environmental consulting. Our success is built on three key pillars: sustainability, innovation, and collaboration. First, our unwavering commitment to sustainability ensures that every project we undertake reduces environmental impact and promotes long-term ecological balance. Second, innovation drives us to develop cutting-edge solutions, from cleaner technologies to efficient resource management. Finally, collaboration with governments, businesses, and communities enables us to achieve meaningful, large-scale change.

I’d like to share a quick story that highlights our values. A few years ago, we were tasked with revitalizing a polluted river system. Despite numerous setbacks, our team worked tirelessly with local authorities and residents, creating a solution that not only restored the river but also provided a sustainable model for future conservation projects.

As we move forward, I encourage each of you to continue challenging the status quo and driving progress in environmental sustainability.

Now, I open the floor to any question you may have

Малечі з дитинства прищеплюють любов до прекрасного, адже це запорука розвитку естетичних смаків, це шлях до добра і гарних вчинків. Людина, що захоплюється красою навколишнього світу не може бути злою, вона націлена та творчість а не на руйнування. Люди намагаються оточити себе прекрасними предметами у побуті, обирають найгарніші речі, щоб прикрасити себе, звертають увагу на те, що милує око, і все це – заради краси. Нажаль, не всі розуміють, що краса буває різною. Зовнішні прояви краси не здатні вплинути на покращення життя у світі, найцінніша – внутрішня краса. Найкрасивіша та людина, у якої гарна душа. Такі люди наділені найкращими якостями, які привертають до себе увагу: вмінням співпереживати, добротою, щирістю, відданістю. Такі люди здатні подарувати оточуючим відчуття насолоди красою, бо саме такі прояви цієї якості і здатні врятувати всесвіт. Треба старатися бути красивим душею, мати потяг до досконалості. Це стремління повинне бути постійним, а не тимчасовим, для того, щоб по вихвалятися своїми гарними якостями. Якщо кожна людина, намагатиметься додати до життя, хоч крапельку прекрасного, світ зміниться на краще. Щезнуть горе, війни та злидні. І тоді, дійсно, рятівником світу стане краса.

Prompt Level: 12-Upper Intermediate [SEP] Prompt: Your friend Kim needs help with emails. Read the beginning of the email. Then, make a list of tips for writing effective emails. Type in the input box. Write 70-90 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: -Make sure the subject line gives the recipient a quick idea of what the email is about.
- Greet the recipient politely.
-Begin with the main purpose of the email early on, especially if it's a business or professional email. Avoid long-winded introductions and stick to the key message.
-Break your content into short paragraphs or bullet points to make it easy to read. Focus on clarity and simplicity. Avoid jargon or overly complicated language.
-Check your grammar, spelling, and punctuation before sending the email. Mistakes can undermine your professionalism.
-Writing in all caps can come across as shouting, and excessive exclamation marks can seem unprofessional.

Prompt Level: Presentations [SEP] Prompt: Your boss has sent you an email, asking you to prepare a presentation about the company. Read the email and draft a speech. I’m Ticiana, and it’s a pleasure to welcome you to Frisko Shipping. Today, I’d like to share a bit about our company’s journey and what makes us a unique and exciting place to work.

Frisko Shipping was founded in 2001 by Bill Frisko. What started as a small venture has now grown into a global powerhouse with locations in 20 cities around the world and more than 5,000 dedicated employees. Last year, we achieved a remarkable profit of 5 million dollars and captured 10 percent of the global market.

But beyond the numbers, what truly sets us apart is our team. We expect our new employees to be motivated and enthusiastic, ready to contribute to our ongoing success.

Let me share a personal story about Bill Frisko, our founder. Many of you might not know this, but Bill’s inspiration to start Frisko Shipping came from a life-changing experience. He once fell into the ocean and was bitten by a shark. Miraculously, a passing ship saved his life. This event sparked his passion for shipping and led to the creation of our company. It’s a powerful reminder that inspiration can come from the most unexpected places.
As you embark on this journey with us, I encourage you to think about what inspires you and how you can bring that passion to your work here at Frisko Shipping. Let’s make waves together and continue to drive our company forward.

Thank you, and welcome aboard!

Prompt Level: 11-Upper Intermediate [SEP] Prompt: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: Media has changed drastically in my lifetime, shifting from traditional formats like newspapers, magazines, and cable television to digital platforms that are fast, interactive, and constantly evolving. When I was younger, the most important sources of information were print newspapers and evening news: they were trusted, routine, and scheduled. Today, I rely heavily on digital media, especially social media platforms, news apps, and podcasts. This change has altered how I consume information; instead of sitting down to read a full newspaper, I scroll through headlines, skim articles, and rely on curated content. While this allows for quicker access to information, it also comes with drawbacks - mainly, the risk of misinformation and the tendency to stay within echo chambers. My reading habits have become more fragmented: I read more frequently, but in shorted bursts, and rarely finish long articles unless they are particularly compelling. Overall, media has become more immediate and accessible; however, it requires more effort to find reliable sources and to stay truly informed.

Prompt Level: Police and Immigration [SEP] Prompt: Now prepare the content for an informative web page about counterfeit goods. Be sure to keep the following points in mind: Types of counterfeit goods, the effect of counterfeiting on society, the signs of a fake, what to do if you discover fake goods.  Write 250-300 words. [SEP] Response: Understanding Counterfeit Goods: Types, Effects, and How to Spot Them

Counterfeit goods are fake products made to look like genuine items. They come in many forms, including counterfeit clothing, accessories, electronics, pharmaceuticals, and even documents. These fake goods are often sold at lower prices, tempting unsuspecting consumers, but they pose serious risks beyond just financial loss.

Types of Counterfeit Goods
Counterfeiting affects a wide range of products. Fashion items like designer clothes, handbags, and watches are commonly counterfeited. Electronics such as smartphones and chargers can be dangerous when made with inferior parts. Pharmaceuticals are especially concerning because fake medicines may lack the proper ingredients, putting lives at risk. Even official documents like passports and driver’s licenses can be forged, causing security concerns.

Effects of Counterfeiting on Society
The impact of counterfeit goods goes far beyond tricking buyers. Economically, counterfeiting leads to billions of dollars in lost revenue for legitimate businesses and governments through unpaid taxes. It also contributes to job losses and stifles innovation. On a societal level, counterfeit products can threaten consumer safety, damage brand reputations, and fund organized crime networks.

How to Spot a Fake
Spotting counterfeit goods requires careful attention. Look for poor-quality materials, uneven stitching, misspelled logos, or packaging errors. Genuine products often have security features such as holograms, watermarks, or serial numbers. If something feels off—whether it’s the weight, texture, or design—trust your instincts.

What to Do if You Discover Fake Goods
If you suspect a product is counterfeit, avoid purchasing or using it. Report your findings to local authorities or consumer protection agencies. If it’s an official document, notify relevant government offices. By staying vigilant and informed, you help protect yourself and the wider community from the harms of counterfeit goods.

Chennai is a city of warmth—both in weather and spirit. The streets hum with the aroma of filter coffee, temple bells, and auto rickshaw chatter. Together, they paint two halves of a world that’s as diverse as it is breathtaking.

Prompt Level: 11-Upper Intermediate [SEP] Prompt: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? What do you use now, and how has it changed your reading habits? Pay attention to your use of commas, colons and semicolons. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: In the past, print media like newspapers, magazines, and books reigned supreme; these were the primary sources of information and entertainment. Now, digital media dominates; we consume content through websites, social media, e-readers, and streaming services. This shift has significantly altered reading habits. I used to spend hours poring over physical books; now, my reading is often fragmented, a mix of articles, blog posts, and social media updates. E-readers offer convenience, allowing me to carry a vast library in one device; however, the constant stream of notifications and distractions can hinder deep engagement with the text. While I still enjoy the tactile experience of a physical book, the accessibility and breadth of online content make digital media an integral part of my reading life
When a lot of our reading occurs this way, our ability to engage in slower, more reflective reading diminishes. Habits developed for digital reading – such as skimming and scanning, which are necessary to handle the volume of information we receive on screens—carry over when we read print

Prompt Level: 13-Advanced [SEP] Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, implemented on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate trade barriers and tariffs, fostering a trilateral trade bloc in North America. As one of the largest free trade zones in the world, it sought to increase economic integration and cross-border trade among the member countries.

NAFTA significantly impacted the economies of the three nations. It facilitated the flow of goods and services, allowing for the reduction of costs associated with import and export processes. This resulted in expanded markets for businesses and consumers, leading to increased competitiveness and economic growth. However, it also faced criticism for contributing to job losses in certain sectors, particularly in manufacturing, as companies relocated production to countries with lower labor costs.

In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which built upon its predecessor's framework while addressing contemporary issues such as digital trade, labor rights, and environmental protections. Despite its controversial aspects, NAFTA played a crucial role in shaping economic relationships and trade policies in North America for over two decades.

Prompt Level: Medical industry [SEP] Prompt: You are a medical resident who writes a blog about the health industry. One of your readers has asked you a question. Read the question, then write a suitable answer. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Becoming a doctor involves extensive education and training, including earning a bachelor's degree, completing medical school, and undergoing residency. This process typically takes over a decade.


Pros of being a doctor include the opportunity to help and heal people, job stability, and a high earning potential. Doctors often report a sense of fulfillment from their work, and they are usually respected in society. The salary varies by specialty, location, and experience, typically ranging from $150,000 to $300,000 annually, with some specialties earning more.


Cons include the long and demanding education, high student debt, long working hours, and significant stress. Doctors carry the heavy responsibility of patient lives in their hands, and they must keep up with ongoing medical advancements and regulations.


Challenges in the profession include dealing with administrative burdens, reduced face-to-face patient time, and the emotional toll of patient outcomes. Balancing work and personal life can also be difficult.

This Confidentiality Agreement ("Agreement") is made between [Employee Name] ("Employee") and [Company Name] ("the Company") on this [day] of [month], [year].

Confidential Information
The Employee acknowledges that they will have access to proprietary and confidential information ("Confidential Information"), including, but not limited to, trade secrets, financial data, business plans, client/customer information, and intellectual property.

Obligation of Confidentiality
The Employee agrees to keep all Confidential Information strictly confidential during and after employment. The Employee will not disclose, use, or permit access to such information for any purpose other than performing their job duties for the Company.

Exceptions
Confidential Information does not include information that:
(a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Employee,
(b) is already known by the Employee at the time of disclosure,
(c) is disclosed under legal obligation, provided the Company is notified promptly.

Return of Property
Upon termination, the Employee agrees to return all materials containing Confidential Information.

Breach
Any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information may result in legal action and immediate termination.

BY: ______________________________________________
Employee

BY: ______________________________________________
For the Company

Prompt Level: Maritime [SEP] Prompt: You are handing over the watch. Make some notes on the information you must include. Write 100-150 words. Type in the input box. [SEP] Response: When handing over the watch, ensure you provide clear and comprehensive information about the ship’s current status. Include the following details: 

- Ship’s position:Latitude, longitude, and proximity to landmarks or navigational hazards.  
- Ship’s speed and movements: Current speed, course, and any planned maneuvers.  
- Vessel’s draft: Forward and aft draft readings.  
- Traffic in the area: Nearby vessels, their courses, and any potential collision risks.  
- State of equipment: Operational status of bridge and engine room equipment, noting any faults.  
- Navigational aids: Status of radar, GPS, autopilot, and other tools.  
- Radiocommunications: Active channels, ongoing communications, and watchkeeping schedules.  
- Weather conditions: Current and forecasted weather, including visibility and sea state.  
- Standing orders: Specific instructions from the captain or previous watch.  
- Special events: Drills, maintenance, or incidents requiring attention.  
- Logs: Ensure all records are up to date and note relevant entries.
